definition: Tolstoy (name)/Count Lev Nikolayevich Tostoy (1828-1910), great Russian novelist, author of War and Peace 戰爭與和平|战争与和平
prop/support (for weight)/rest (e.g. arm rest)/thanks to/to hold in one's hand/to support in one's palm/to give/to base/to commit/to set/torr (unit of pressure)
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]
Mt Tai 泰山[Tai4 Shan1] in Shandong/abbr. for Thailand
Tolstoy (name)/Count Lev Nikolayevich Tostoy (1828-1910), great Russian novelist, author of War and Peace 戰爭與和平|战争与和平
pinyin: Lie4 fu1 · Tuo1 er3 si1 tai4

sentences.english: It's a Tolstoy-esque War and Peace of a game .
sentences.chinese: 它是一個托爾斯泰戰爭與和平的遊戲。

sentences.english: Tolstoy became a kind of prophet in his old age, during the last few decades.
sentences.chinese: 晚年，在其辭世前的一二十年，托爾斯泰象個傳道者。

sentences.english: He likened the story to Tolstoy's moral tales.
sentences.chinese: 他把這個故事比做托爾斯泰的道德名篇。

sentences.english: By turning Tolstoy into an icon, the Soviets ultimately hollowed him out.
sentences.chinese: 前蘇聯人通過把托爾斯泰樹立爲偶像，最終把淘空了。

sentences.english: Considers that Sholokhov practiced Toistoy's theory of "Art is an expression of feelings".
sentences.chinese: 托爾斯泰的“藝術就是情感表達”的偉大理論。

sentences.english: There is great humanity in all the writings of Tolstoy.
sentences.chinese: 托爾斯泰所有的作品都充滿了偉大的仁愛。

sentences.english: These squabbling Tolstoys and their stilted histrionics were conceited and exasperating.
sentences.chinese: 這些鬥嘴的托爾斯泰們和他們誇張的表演真令人惱火。

sentences.english: Tolstoy hated Shakespeare because he didn't take a stand.
sentences.chinese: 托爾斯泰厭憎莎士比亞，因爲他認爲後者沒有立場。

sentences.english: Tostoy was hardly aware of all the commotion.
sentences.chinese: 對於這一切騷動，托爾斯泰幾乎無知無覺。

sentences.english: Leo Tolstoi was also a communication theorist but of almost the opposite sort.
sentences.chinese: 托爾斯泰也是一個交流論者，卻幾乎是相反的一類。

sentences.english: Tolstoy bombards you with twenty-two names .
sentences.chinese: 托爾斯泰一下子就拋給你二十二個人名。

sentences.english: Among the Russian scholars in this field Vasilyev and Tolstay are the representative figures.
sentences.chinese: 其中，瓦西里耶夫和托爾斯泰是最具代表性的人物。

definition: Anton Pavlovich Chekhov (1860-1904), Russian writer famous for his short stories and plays
Marcus Tullius Cicero (106-43 BC), famous Roman politician, orator and philosopher, murdered at the orders of Marc Anthony
Handel (name)/George Frideric Handel (1685-1759), German-born Baroque composer, naturalized British in 1727
lit. paper has become expensive in Luoyang (because everyone is making a copy of a popular story) (idiom)/fig. (of a product) to sell like hotcakes
Lai Shengchuan (1954-), US-Taiwanese dramatist and director
